description: The free access spells are generic spells that every spellcaster can learn, no matter which paths he chose. When a spellcaster learn a path, he can learn among those spells to complete his path and make it unique.

spells.name: ﻿Create Fire
spells.effect: This spell creates fire intensities if cast upon a flammable substance. If fire catches on, it will not be necessary to maintain the spell.

spells.name: Move Objects
spells.effect: This spell moves inorganic objects without the need of physical contact, by granting them a Flight Value 10. Maximum weight that can be affected is based on spell level.

spells.name: Cleanliness
spells.effect: This spell removes any minor physical impurity (such as dirt or bad smell) in the target’s body and clothes. It can also be used to clean places or objects. It can affect up to a maximum Presence based on spell level.

spells.name: Jump
spells.effect: The targeted individual can supernaturally enhance his Jump Ability.

advancedGrade.effect: +150 Jump/Allows reaching Inhuman in Jump checks.

arcaneGrade.effect: +200 Jump/Allows reaching Zen in Jump checks.

spells.name: Create Music
spells.effect: This spell creates music that is audible in a radius. The piece is performed with a Music Ability based on spell level. This spell can only play pieces the caster is familiar with, even if only in a vague way.

spells.name: Opening
spells.effect: This spell allows the caster to open any closed door. If the door is blocked, the spell will try to force it by employing a Lock Picking ability based on spell level.

spells.name: Tie
spells.effect: This spell causes chains, ropes, or any type of string to be knotted with an Ability in Sleight of Hand based on spell level. The caster may command strings to tie a subject up, in which case the target will have to fight off an automatic attack of Absurd Difficulty, following the rules of Trapping (this is to say, he would receive a direct attack with a final ability of 180). The Strength of the binding depends on the material used. Just as a reference, a very thick rope would have Strength of 10, whereas metallic chains would have Strength 12. Note that strings are not created by the spell.

spells.name: Magic Detection
spells.effect: The caster automatically detects any source of magic in a radius around him. If the magic is hidden, this spell employs the equivalent of a Magic Appraisal Ability based on spell level.

spells.name: Stop Fall
spells.effect: This spell cancels the effects of falling from great heights. In game terms, it completely eliminates the impact of falling from a distance. It may affect several individuals simultaneously, provided the total of their Presences is not higher than the spell limit.

spells.name: Undo Writing
spells.effect: The spell will erase a text. The material upon which the text is imprinted is could be altered by this spell, but not in a damaging way. For instance, the spell causes ink to fade away, or the space created by engraving to be refilled. This spell can only affect objects with a Presence less than the spell limit.

spells.name: Static Message
spells.effect: This spell creates a written message in a particular place or on an object. The spellcaster can make this message appear and disappear at will, even when not physically present. However, if not present, he will not know if the message is actually read by someone.

spells.name: Change Color
spells.effect: This spell will change the color of objects, or even people, provided their Presence does not exceed the spell limit. The target can resist this spell by passing a MR Check.

spells.name: Create Sounds
spells.effect: This spell creates a sound in a specific place away from the caster.

spells.name: Recreate Image
spells.effect: This spell recreates an image previously seen by the spellcaster, with a maximum surface set by spell level. This apparition is a transparent hologram with no substance that remains motionless and stationary.

arcaneGrade.effect: 15 cubic meter/116 cubic yard. / The Image seems real so a Notice Check of Very Difficult or a Search check of Medium is required to understand it’s not real.

spells.name: Enchant
spells.effect: This spell turns an object or place into a supernatural element. The newly enchanted substance affects intangible beings and spells. For instance, if cast upon a weapon, the weapon will be able to inflict damage upon immaterial beings (employing the object’s Presence). Likewise, ethereal beings could not pass through an enchanted wall. Can be cast on multiple objects as far as the Maximum Presence affected is equal to or below the maximum.

spells.name: Breathe Liquids
spells.effect: This spell enables targets to breathe in a liquid environment just as easily as they do in air. It may affect several individuals simultaneously provided the total of their Presences is not higher than the limit set by the spell.

spells.name: Climb
spells.effect: The targeted individual has his Climb Ability supernaturally enhanced. The spell adds a bonus to the base of a character’s Climb Ability.

advancedGrade.effect: +150 Climb / Can reach Inhuman levels in Climb checks.

arcaneGrade.effect: +200 Climb / Can reach Zen levels in Climb checks.

spells.name: Fog
spells.effect: This spell creates fog in a radius. Density may be determined by the caster. The fog remains stationary unless affected by wind. Light breezes will make the fog drift; stronger winds simply disperse the fog.

spells.name: Slippery Area
spells.effect: This spell enchants a static radius area, rendering it as slippery as wet ice. Crossing this field without slipping requires an Acrobatics or Athleticism Check of Difficult if walking, or of Absurd if running.

arcaneGrade.effect: 100m/109yd area / Waking difficulty is increased to Very Hard, running to Impossible.

spells.name: Repair
spells.effect: This spell repairs an inorganic object entirely, but it does not recreate missing pieces. Performing the repair requires that the fragments of the object are preserved, or that the necessary raw materials are available. It can be cast upon anything, from weapons to buildings.

spells.name: Pass Without Leaving Trace
spells.effect: This spell eliminates the physical traces people leave behind. It takes an Impossible -level Track Check to follow the traces of anyone using this spell. The caster may affect as many individuals as he wishes, provided the total of theirPresences is not higher than the limit set by spell level.

advancedGrade.effect: Max Presence 240 / An Inhuman Track check is required to find the traces.

arcaneGrade.effect: Max Presence 320 / A Zen Track check is required to find the traces.

spells.name: Attract Minor Vermin
spells.effect: This spell summons small vermin to a designated spot. This spell does not create new creatures; it merely attracts existing vermin in the area. This spell does not grant any control over these creatures.

spells.name: Infinite Bag
spells.effect: This spell permits characters to fill a bag, sack, or chest more than its normal storage capacity – without increasing its weight. The caster can always draw the exact object he needs from the container, whereas the rest of the characters will stumble upon random objects. Objects are still limited to a size that would normally fit inside the container, so this spell would not, for example, permit a wagon to be stored inside a typical backpack. The load fully materializes upon termination of the spell; in this way, it is possible that the container may burst.

spells.name: Inhumanity
spells.effect: Targets of this spell are able to achieve Inhuman-difficulty results. This spell can affect several individuals simultaneously. No Max Presence affected.

initialGrade.effect: Can reach Inhumanity in a determined Ability.

intermediateGrade.effect: Can reach Inhumanity in all Abilities.

advancedGrade.effect: Can reach Inhumanity in all Abilities and Zen in a determined Ability.

arcaneGrade.effect: Can reach Zen in all Abilities.

spells.name: Clouds
spells.effect: This spell forms a thick layer of clouds. The caster is in complete control of them and may move them around or shape them in any way he pleases.

spells.name: Cause Fear
spells.effect: All creatures within a radius of the caster fall prey to a terrible magical fear – unless they pass a MR Check. Those who fail the Check are subjected to the Fear State.

spells.name: Magical Protection
spells.effect: This spell grants armor protection against all attacks except for Energy-based attacks. It can be used in conjunction with any other form of protection as an additional layer. However, it does not cause special penalties to be applied to the Initiative.

spells.name: Magic Shield
spells.effect: This spell creates a magical Shield that will protect the caster from all attacks – including those of a supernatural nature.

spells.name: Speed
spells.effect: Effect:This spell raises a subject’s Movement Value and also applies a bonus to his Initiative. Halve Movement bonus beyond 12.

spells.name: Serenity
spells.effect: This spell produces a feeling of tranquility and peace in the target, inducing calm even when experiencing rage or terror. It cancels all fear, terror, or rage States experienced by the target – except if they are of a supernatural nature. A character can resist this spell by passing a MR Check.

spells.name: Net
spells.effect: This spell will create high density magical fibers that form a very sticky net. The caster can use this net for whatever he may desire, such as blocking a passage or entrapping creatures. The net’s maximum size is determined by spell level. It Traps with a Strength of 10, and it can endure 500 points of damage before Breaking (at base level) using an AT 4. Since its substance is of a mystical nature, only heat, or supernatural attacks will harm it.

initialGrade.effect: 3 square meters/3 square feet / 500 Life Points.

intermediateGrade.effect: 6 square meters/6 square feet / 750 Life Points.

advancedGrade.effect: 9 square meters/10 square feet / 1000 Life Points.

arcaneGrade.effect: 12 square meters/13 square feet / 1500 Life Points / Trap with Strength12.

spells.name: Understand Languages
spells.effect: This spell will allow the targeted individual to gain temporary proficiency in a language previously not spoken by him. The spell may affect as many individuals as Designated. No max Presence affected.

initialGrade.effect: Affects basic languages, spoken and known by many people in all countries of the world.

intermediateGrade.effect: Affects strange and unusual languages, spoken by minorities or no longer used in any society.

advancedGrade.effect: Affects unique languages and completely forgotten languages.

spells.name: Levitation
spells.effect: Targets of this spell gain the ability to levitate their bodies vertically in the air. This spell may affect as many targets as necessary . No max Presence affected.

spells.name: Send Message
spells.effect: This spell sends an oral message to a familiar person. The message can be in any language.

spells.name: Contraceptive Protection
spells.effect: This spell prevents sexually transmitted diseases and pregnancy. It may affect several individuals simultaneously the total of their Presence scores do not exceed 80 (at base level).

spells.name: Close With Magic
spells.effect: This spell automatically closes any door or lock, increasing the necessary Difficulty to open it by one degree. In other words, a door requiring a Medium-Difficulty Lock Picking Check to open would now require a Difficult Check. Although the lock itself is enchanted, the caster doesn’t need to pay for maintenance; the spell will be active until the door opens. This spell will only affect one lock at a time.

spells.name: True Close
spells.effect: The caster is automatically able to obstruct any type of door, shutter, or window with a Presence of 20 or below (at base level). If cast upon an open door, this spell causes it to close by itself, or if it has a latch, the spell will fasten it closed. For as long as the spell is maintained, there will be no physical way to open the door short of destruction or employing other magical means.

spells.name: Purification
spells.effect: This spell purifies a body by eliminating any harmful substances from its system, such as poisons. It automatically eradicates any substance of Level 30 or below (at base level). Purification only affects the harmful elements of an organism, and those alien to it. In this way, a Purification spell cast upon a poisonous snake would not remove the snake’s own poison, but the same spell cast upon a person bitten by the snake would be purified. The spell may affect as many individuals as designated.

spells.name: Change of Outlook
spells.effect: This spell modifies the face and body of its target. It can alter skin color or physiognomy, but it cannot change height or weight beyond the limits set by the character’s Size. In order to resist the makeover, a character must pass a MR Check. If he fails the Check, he receives a new one each day.

spells.name: Alter Size
spells.effect: This spell increases or decreases the target’s Size, the lowest value for size is 1. In order to resist the spell, characters must pass a MR check.

spells.name: Invoke Aggressiveness
spells.effect: This spell increases aggressiveness in all living creatures and persons within range of the caster. Each affected target can resist the spell with a MR Check. The affected individuals will show violent behavior around any person or object that may serve as a target of their rage.

spells.name: Eliminate Spells
spells.effect: This spell destroys another active spell.

spells.name: Resistance to Pain
spells.effect: This spell increases a living being’s endurance, applying a bonus to its Withstand Pain Checks.

advancedGrade.effect: +150 Withstand Pain / Can achieve Inhumanity in Withstand Pain checks.

arcaneGrade.effect: +200 Withstand Pain / Can achieve Zen in Withstand Pain checks.

spells.name: Magic Beam
spells.effect: This spell projects a magical energy discharge that uses the Energy AT.

spells.name: Eliminate Dreams
spells.effect: The spell suppresses an individual’s ability to dream. Those wishing to resist must pass an MR Check. The Check may be repeated every time the character falls asleep. If cast on a character in The Wake, that character is immediately banished to the real world.

spells.name: Extend Presence
spells.effect: The caster is able to extend his Presence away from his body, allowing him to perform action at a distance. As long as the Presence is detached from the body, the caster is unable to move, but he can return to his body without the need of ending the spell. The Presence is able to touch physical objects and even attack, but it is invisible to the human eye. The only way to notice its presence is via Ki detection, the ability to see spirits, or some other means of seeing ethereal bodies. However, if the Presence is holding an object, that object will be perfectly visible. The Presence is intangible and can only be harmed by Energy based attacks. Any Life Point lost will also affect the caster’s body.

arcaneGrade.effect: 100m/109yd / The spell also creates copies of the objects brought by the character allowing him to use them with his expanded presence.

spells.name: Heal Diseases
spells.effect: This spell automatically eliminates any illness of Level 30 or below (at base level). It may be cast upon several individuals, provided that the sum of their Presences does not exceed 80 (at base level).

spells.name: Sense Feelings
spells.effect: This spell detects a specific feeling in an individual in range of the caster. It is up to him to decide what  feeling he would like to perceive. Affected subjects can avoid the effects of the spell by passing a MR or PsR Check.

spells.name: Cancel Magic
spells.effect: This spell cancels the effects of all spells in a radius that have a Zeonic value below the spell limit. Keep in mind that the spells are not destroyed; the effects are merely neutralized within the area for the duration of the spell.

spells.name: Undo
spells.effect: This spell destroys inorganic material, provided it does not pass a MR Check.

spells.name: Curse
spells.effect: This spell creates a number of negative conditions on the affected individual with the goal of bringing misfortune when the affected target attempts a specific action. Every time the accursed character attempts the specified action, it automatically fails.It is in the nature of this spell to influence not only the target, but also those around him, if they enter the field of the curse. In this case, each person is entitled to their own MR Check. For instance, a young girl romantically interested in a boy who is affected by a curse that prevents anyone from falling in love with him would feel discouraged in her endeavor, unless she passes the MR Check. New Checks can be made only after their effects are re-activated.Casting Level Base Intermediate Advanced Arcane

initialGrade.effect: The Curse only affects very concrete actions, like falling in love with someone or writing a poem for the king and simply causes accidents that impede the character to fully accomplish what he wishes / MR 120.

intermediateGrade.effect: The Curse also affects generic actions, like falling in love, fighting, helping others, it causes real bad luck by not allowing the target to reach his objective or in case of primary or secondary abilities, apply a -60 penalty each time he utilizes it / MR 140.

advancedGrade.effect: The Curse affects any action or condition and causes all classes of negative conditions to the target (pain, bleeding, and muteness) or, in case of cursing an ability, it causes a penalty of -80 each time it’s utilized / MR 160.

arcaneGrade.effect: The Curse can have any level of complexity and cause major effects, including death to those that operate within its bonds / MR 180.

spells.name: Read Minds
spells.effect: This spell enables the caster to delve into a subject’s memories or thoughts. It is left to the GM’s best judgment to decide the number of Combat Turns needed to find the desired information, depending on how deep it is buried in the character’s memory. The target may resist the spell by passing a PsR or MR Check. The caster will apply a +30 bonus to all Opposed Checks against him for as long as he can read his opponent’s intentions.

spells.name: Alter Energy
spells.effect: The caster can transform Intensities of any kind of elemental energy, such as fire, into another kind, such as electricity. If these Intensities are magical or have a Presence of their own, they can resist the spell by passing a MR Check. This spell does not damage Elemental Beings, but alters their elemental nature.

spells.name: Send Dreams
spells.effect: This spell allows the caster to send images and words to a sleeping person’s subconscious. The spell does not constitute a means of communication, since the caster will have no feedback on the actions or words of the target. The message may be delivered to any subject designated by the caster, regardless of distance. The target must be asleep to receive the message.

initialGrade.effect: The dream shall be very vague and not explanatory, allowing only to show fragmented images, unconnected phrases and sounds.

intermediateGrade.effect: The dream shall be vague but will allow showing the dreamer sequences and places.

advancedGrade.effect: The message shall be clear, transmitting a comprehensible message as well as images and sequences created by the caster.

arcaneGrade.effect: The dreams shall be completely clear and hold a vague conscience as that of the caster, allowing the dreamer to interact with them and make suppositions.

spells.name: Friendship
spells.effect: This spell creates a bond of friendship between two characters designated by the caster. Keep in mind that the affected characters do not become stupid, meaning they will not follow their new friend’s advice blindly. At any rate, they will act according to their ethics and personality. Characters wishing to resist this spell need to pass a MR or PsR Check. The Check will only be repeated once a day, or in a case where something sheds doubt on the true camaraderie between the characters.

spells.name: Cause Sickness
spells.effect: This spell causes sickness in any individual who fails the required DR Check.

spells.name: Quick Transport
spells.effect: This spell transports the target. The spell allows characters to pass through physical bodies, provided they are not based on energy. No Max Presence Affected. Does not allow transporting someone in an unnatural position (for example, in the middle of air.).

spells.name: Slow
spells.effect: This spell decreases the Movement Value of a target if it fails a MR Check.

spells.name: Show the Invisible
spells.effect: This spell exposes any force or invisible presence to public view. The spell reveals not only supernatural effects, but also beings of a spiritual nature, or those who are completely invisible. The spell covers a radius and affected creatures avoid manifesting themselves by passing a MR Check. The only condition for being affected by the spell is being inside the area.

spells.name: Absorb Information
spells.effect: The caster can use this spell to absorb knowledge in any written or graphic media that is within sight or at hand. In this way, he can read a book in a few seconds and remember the details as if he had studied it carefully. He may read up to 500 words (or an equivalent amount of information) for every turn the spell is maintained. Once the spell is finished, the caster’s memory will be responsible for storing the information correctly. Memorize checks to remember information acquired through this spell are reduced in difficulty by 2 Levels.

initialGrade.effect: A short and not very complex book.

intermediateGrade.effect: A big volume of great complexity.

arcaneGrade.effect: The knowledge of an entire library.

spells.name: Blindness
spells.effect: The spell will cause anyone within a radius to go blind if they fail a MR Check.

spells.name: Visualize Cartography
spells.effect: This spell enables the caster to visualize the surrounding landscape in a radius. The spell is effective for locating cities, rivers, and mountains, however, specific individuals or constructions can not be placed.

spells.name: Deafness
spells.effect: The spell will causes anyone within a radius to go deaf if they fail a MR Check.

spells.name: Inability to Speak
spells.effect: The spell causes any creature within a radius to become mute if they fail a MR Check.

spells.name: Heal Wounds
spells.effect: This spell heals any kind of wound and restores Life Points to the target. This type of healing will not regenerate missing organs or similar damage, but it will stop the effects of bleeding.

spells.name: Eliminate Fatigue
spells.effect: This spell induces recovery from physical exhaustion, allowing characters to regain Fatigue Points.

spells.name: Magic Saddle
spells.effect: This spell creates a supernatural being whose sole purpose is that of transport. The creature has no attack ability, and it defends according to the rules for Damage Resistance creatures, and its AT is calculated according to its Size. Magic Saddle uses Ki Weight Elimination rules for moving. The creature has Athleticism 200.

initialGrade.effect: Movement 10, 500 Life Points, Strength 10, Max Size 20

intermediateGrade.effect: Movement 12, 1000 Life Points, Strength 12, Max Size 22

advancedGrade.effect: Movement 14, 1500 Life Points, Strength 14, Max Size 24

arcaneGrade.effect: Movement 15, 2000 Life Points, Strength 15, Max Size 28

spells.name: Walk on Walls
spells.effect: Characters gain the ability to walk on walls or ceilings as if they were walking on the ground. No Max Presence Affected

initialGrade.effect: Can move up to with Movement equal to ¼ of Base Movement.

intermediateGrade.effect: Can move up to with Movement equal to ½ of Base Movement.

arcaneGrade.effect: Can move or stand still with absolute control on any surface, such as a falling feather, a thread or jumping from a drop of rain to another.

spells.name: Merge With Body
spells.effect: This spell merges one or several objects, such as weapons, suits of armor, lock picks, with the designated character. The object remains hidden under some visible form, such as a scar or a tattoo, until the time the owner decides to disclose it. The maximum Presence of objects merged cannot exceed the limit set by spell level. As long as they remain hidden, no weight or size penalties are applied to the bearer, but neither will the bearer receive any bonuses or advantages from hidden objects. No object exceeding ten times the bearer’s size can be merged. It takes a full turn for a merged object to materialize and detach from a character.

spells.name: Acid Cloud
spells.effect: This spell forms a corrosive cloud that melts any substance by mere contact. All bodies in contact with the cloud must pass a PhR Check or lose a number of Life Points equal to Failure Level of the Check. Those objects that fail the Resistance by 50 points lose 1 level of quality. For every turn that bodies are exposed to the cloud and fail the Check, they receive a –10 cumulative penalty to their subsequent Check. The cloud has a radius, and it moves at the caster’s will. The caster can not select targets within the area of the cloud and may even be affected himself.

spells.name: Leave Unprotected
spells.effect: This spell lowers the victim’s AT if he, or his armor, fails a MR Check

spells.name: Sleep
spells.effect: This spell induces a deep sleep on all subjects within a 30-foot radius who do not pass a MR Check. Affected characters fall fast asleep in little more than a minute. If a character fails the Check by more than 20 points, the effects of the spell will be instantaneous. The affected parties remain asleep for the duration of the spell. Potential interruptions of sleep during the spell will provide opportunities to reroll the Check.

spells.name: Increase Psychic Characteristics
spells.effect: This spell adds 1 point to one of the Psychic Characteristics: Intelligence, Power, Willpower, or Perception. An Intelligence boost does not allow the caster to increase the maximum potential of his spells. A single casting of this spell can only affect one of the above characteristics at a time. Increasing a characteristic beyond 12 requires two points.

spells.name: Minor Alteration
spells.effect: This spell enables the caster to shape inorganic matter in such a way as to change one object into another of similar characteristics and the same Presence. For instance, a harpoon may be turned into a spear, since they are shaped similarly and they have the same Presence, but a harpoon could not be turned into a two-handed sword, since Presence and form differ greatly from one another. The maximum Presence affected is based on spell level.

spells.name: Create Emotion
spells.effect: This spell creates a specifically designated feeling or emotion within a particular character. The Difficulty for the MR or PsR Check to avoid this spell is based on spell level. A character receives a new Check each day and whenever he becomes suspicious of being supernaturally influenced.

spells.name: Paralyze
spells.effect: Any subject in range is exposed to the effects of Total Paralysis unless they pass a MR check.

spells.name: Increase Physical Characteristics
spells.effect: This spell adds one point to one of the Physical Characteristics: Dexterity, Agility, Strength, or Constitution. A single casting of this spell can only affect one of the above characteristics at a time. Increasing a characteristic beyond 12 requires two points.

spells.name: Magical Weapon
spells.effect: The caster uses magic to devise a supernatural weapon. His work is treated as a Quality Energy damaging object. No Max Presence.

spells.name: Weakness
spells.effect: The target of this spell is temporarily subjected to Weakness (as explained in Chapter 14) unless he passes a MR Check.

spells.name: Body to Magic
spells.effect: The designated body transforms into magical energy. No Max Presence Affected.

initialGrade.effect: Can only be damaged by attacks that can damage Energy.

intermediateGrade.effect: As Base, but allows to move through anything material that cannot touch energy.

arcaneGrade.effect: As Advanced, but all damage from magic effects and spells is halved.

spells.name: Resist
spells.effect: This spell enhances one type of Resistance.

spells.name: Forgetfulness
spells.effect: This spell affects the target’s memory, causing him to forget whatever the caster desires if he fails a MR or PsR Check. If the memories being targeted are deeply rooted in the character, a +40 may apply to his MR Check. The spell has no maintenance, but the target is entitled to make another Check when faced with potential reminders. The spell does not affect a character’s abilities, only conscious memory.

spells.name: Rejection
spells.effect: This spell imbues a body with magical energy that provokes a Strength 8 impact (at base level) on anyone coming into contact with it. When such an impact occurs, the two affected beings make an Agility or Strength Opposed Check. The difference between that check, along with possible additional effects of the surrounding environment determine the severity of damage, at the GM’s discretion. The designated body cannot have a Presence higher than the limit set by the spell.

spells.name: Plague
spells.effect: This spell must be cast upon a subject or place infected with a disease. By doing so, the infection is automatically spread to all individuals in range. Affected beings are entitled to a DR Check to avoid he contagion.

arcaneGrade.effect: 25km/15.5mile area / Max Disease Level 80 / The DR for the disease is increased by +10.

spells.name: Uselessness
spells.effect: The target becomes clumsy and unable to perform physical maneuvers. He must pass a MR Check or suffer penalties to his actions equivalent to the number by which he failed the Check. The spell cannot affect magical, psychic, or perceptive abilities.

spells.name: Levitation Sphere
spells.effect: This spell causes objects and creatures in a radius to levitate. The caster can decide what will levitate and what will not, regardless of weight or size. Objects or people suspended in the air are moved by the caster with a Flight Value 6. Those wishing to resist the effects must pass a MR check. Only animated or live beings are entitled to a Resistance Check, as are constructions endowed with supernatural Characteristics.

spells.name: Flight
spells.effect: The target is able to move with Flight Value.

spells.name: Dominion
spells.effect: This spell bends the will of anyone who does not pass a MR or PsR check. The affected party is entitled to a new Check only when ordered to perform an action completely against its nature. A +20 may be applied to his roll if the order is exceptionally adverse.

spells.name: Defensive Erudition
spells.effect: With the aid of this spell, the caster is able to increase his defensive Magic Projection. Only one Defensive Erudition spell at a time can be used on a specific subject.

spells.name: Invisibility
spells.effect: This spell renders one or several bodies designated by the caster invisible. It affects as many people as desired. Only by passing a Notice Check or a Search Check may an individual perceive an invisible body.

initialGrade.effect: Notice against Impossible and Search against Absurd.

intermediateGrade.effect: Notice against Inhuman and Search against Almost Impossible.

advancedGrade.effect: Notice against Zen and Search against Impossible.

arcaneGrade.effect: Cannot be perceived with the sense of sight.

spells.name: Deflect Trajectory
spells.effect: The caster can alter a moving body’s trajectory, redirecting its course as he pleases. This spell can affect objects of any mass, from an arrow to a large ship. However, this spell does not cause stationary objects to move; it modifies the direction of those objects already in motion. Deflect Trajectory can also be used defensively against weapon attacks. If the caster succeeds in his Magic Projection defense, he manages to redirect the attack to another opponent. The spell may be resisted by passing a MR check.

spells.name: Stall Spell
spells.effect: This spell allows for another spell to be stored inside an object to be used later, possibly by a different spellcaster. Stall Spell must be cast at the same time as the spell it will affect. The spell that is stalled may be stored in any available object – easily transported items such as jewelry, staves, and pebbles are common choices. The stalled spell can be activated later, by any caster who pays the exact Zeonic cost with which the spell was cast. The spellcaster in possession of the object is in full control of the spell as if he were the original caster, and he will even be allowed to pay for Maintenance, if applicable. The stalled spell may be reused, as long as the same Zeonic cost is paid again. For example, an archmage could store a Zeonic-value 80 Fire Ball in a staff and give it to his apprentice, who could then use the staff to cast a Fire Ball every time he had 80 Zeonic points to spend.

spells.name: Containment
spells.effect: This spell haunts a given place, making it impossible for anyone entering it or, for those already within its boundaries, to leave the area unless they pass a MR check. Beings within the area of the Containment can move and act normally within the spell’s boundaries. Subjects are not allowed to repeat the Check for as long as the spell is being maintained – unless they increase their Resistances. The caster can not select targets in the area and may even be subject to the spell himself. Area of coverage is based on spell level, and the condition to be affected by this spell is being inside its area in the next round it is cast.

spells.name: Detection Mark
spells.effect: This spell allows the caster to inscribe an arcane mark on a person, creature, or object. The mark channels the caster’s five senses, allowing him to experience the sights, sounds, smells, tastes, and physical sensations surrounding the mark, regardless of its location. The caster is also always aware of the exact location of the mark.  Living beings and supernatural objects can avoid this spell by passing a MR Check. No Max Presence Affected, but the Mark is effective within a maximum distance depending on casting level.

spells.name: Offensive Erudition
spells.effect: With the aid of this spell, the caster is able to increase his offensive Magic Projection. Only one Offensive Erudition spell at a time can be used on a specific subject.

spells.name: Perfect Target
spells.effect: This spell enchants a conventional projectile, causing it to reach its target inevitably. The projectile uses the ability of its thrower, and opponents defend themselves using the conventional rules against projectiles. Nevertheless, the supernatural nature of the spell grants the offender a bonus to the Attack, allowing the thrower to bypass the shooting difficulties in Table 45. Range is not a factor; as long as the caster has line of sight to the target, it can be hit. Perfect Target must be cast in the same round as the projectile is fired. No Max Presence affected.

spells.name: Disenchantment
spells.effect: This spell automatically destroys magical objects with Presence scores lower than the limit indicated by spell level. The caster can choose whether to destroy the object completely or simply to deprive it of its supernatural qualities.

spells.name: Natural Spell
spells.effect: Natural Spell allows the caster to tie his essence to one or more spells prepared in advance, thus enabling him to cast them later as many times as he likes with zero Zeonic cost. In this way, the spellcaster can perform one of these spells innately per turn. At the time of using this natural spell, the caster can’t accumulate magic or prepare any other spells. Only one Natural Spell at a time may be kept active.

spells.name: Immortality
spells.effect: Targets of this spell do not age or in any way suffer the passage of time for as long as the spell remains active. If this spell is discontinued or destroyed, the affected individual will catch up with his real age at a much accelerated speed.

intermediateGrade.effect: As Base, but also grants immunity to natural Poisons and Diseases.

advancedGrade.effect: As Intermediate, but the character cannot die of bleeding-out or physical damage of natural origin.

arcaneGrade.effect: As Advanced, but the character can suffer any level of physical damage without dying unless he suffers a lethal Critical on one of his vulnerable points. Note that he normally suffers action penalties due to damage.

spells.name: Eliminate Needs
spells.effect: This spell completely removes most physical needs from one or more individuals. As long as the spell is kept active, the targets do not need to eat, drink, or sleep. This spell may be applied to as many individuals as the caster wishes. Allows normal spending of Fatigue Points and penalties for low fatigue are ignored.

intermediateGrade.effect: As Base, but the character is also immune to natural climatic effects.

advancedGrade.effect: As Intermediate, but the character is immune to all action penalties caused by natural effects.

arcaneGrade.effect: As Advanced, but the character recovers 1 Fatigue Point per turn.

spells.name: Steal Spell
spells.effect: This spell allows the caster to take control of another spell that does not belong to him and treat it as he had cast it himself. The stolen spell’s Zeonic value can not exceed the limit set by spell level. Only maintenance spells can be stolen, not automatic action spells. The original spellcaster can attempt to prevent this theft by passing a MR Check.

spells.name: Gate
spells.effect: Gate generates a magical door between two distant places. Anyone crossing it is automatically transported to the other side. The spell remains linked to the spot where it is cast and to the designated exit. Therefore, the spellcaster will not be able to change its location at a later stage. He will, however, be able to decide if it will work in only one or both directions at the time the spell is cast. The gate's size, maximum distance, and number of people it can transport a day is limited by the spell level.

arcaneGrade.effect: 50m/54yd opening / any distance / Any Presence per day.

spells.name: Magic Prism
spells.effect: This spell solidifies magic, creating a supernatural container for Zeon. In game terms, it creates a magic container. The container appears empty. Only one Magic Prism spell at a time may be kept active.

spells.name: Location
spells.effect: Location can be used for finding the exact position of a person, place, or object at a specified time, provided it is in range of the caster. The caster must be able identify a specific target; general inquiries do work with this spell. For example, he will not be able to find his brother’s murderer unless he knows exactly who it is. Characters wishing to avoid detection must pass a MR Check. Very spacious areas impose a –40 penalty to this Check.

spells.name: Physical Immunity
spells.effect: The designated object or individual is made completely invulnerable to any damage not Energy related. It may be applied to as many individuals as the caster wishes, as long as their total Presence scores remain under the limit set by spell level.

spells.name: Spell Return
spells.effect: This spell turns an active spell against the original caster or any other target selected. The returned spell uses the same Magic Projection as the person who cast it. Return is an automatic effect.

spells.name: Prepare Spell
spells.effect: This spell allows the caster to introduce a second spell inside an object or person, so that it can automatically be cast later, without preparation or accumulation. Prepare Spell must be cast at the same time as the spell it will affect. The prepared spell may be activated by the caster, the subject hosting it, or the bearer of the enchanted object. It uses the Magic Projection of the original caster, unless the bearer decides to use his own. Once cast, the spell vanishes. If maintenance payment of Prepare Spell is discontinued, the second spell will be lost as well. Only one prepared spell may be cast per turn, regardless of how many spells there are stored inside an object. An object or person may contain up to four times its Presence in Zeonic value. This means an individual with a Presence of 50 could have up to 200 Zeon points in prepared spells.

spells.name: Teletransportation
spells.effect: The caster, or whomever the caster designates, can instantly travel anywhere, distance based on spell level. The spell allows characters to pass through physical bodies, provided they are not based on Energy. It may be applied to as many individuals as the conjurer wishes, as long as their total Presence scores do not exceed the spell limit.

spells.name: Eye of Time
spells.effect: This is a limited time travel spell allows the caster to witness any event that might have occurred in his current location. After the spell becomes active, the caster may he may go back and forth in time at will, but he may not physically move more than a single step in any direction, or the spell immediately ends.

spells.name: Seal
spells.effect: Seal will stall a maintained Spiritual spell in someone, making it impossible for the target to be freed from its effects. This enchantment is used on Spiritual spells previously cast successfully on an individual who failed the Resistance Check. In this way, the affected character loses all ability to make another MR Check, regardless of general rules or what the spell itself dictates, until the Spiritual spell itself is destroyed or maintenance is discontinued. Seal has no effect upon non-maintenance spells or those restricted to a specific area.

initialGrade.effect: Affects spells in casting Base Level.

intermediateGrade.effect: Affects spells in casting Intermediate Level.

advancedGrade.effect: Affects spells in casting Advanced Level.

arcaneGrade.effect: Affects spells in casting Arcane Level.

spells.name: The Gift of Knowledge
spells.effect: This spell grants the target bonus points to Secondary Abilities of the Intellectual field, which he may distribute freely as he sees fit. Only one Gift of Knowledge may be active in any given subject at a time. No more than +340 can be allocated to a single Intellectual Secondary Ability.

spells.name: Shield against Powers
spells.effect: This spell affects a specific area within which no supernatural powers can take effect if they are under the limit set by the spell level. No spells, no Psychic Powers, and no Ki Technique will work within this area. In the same way, no Summoning activities are allowed. The maximum area covered with this spell is based on spell level, which remains stationary. Not even the caster may use Powers anymore within the selected area.

initialGrade.effect: 50m/54yd area / Zeon 100 / Psychic Potential 140 / Ki Cost 8 / Summoning 180.

intermediateGrade.effect: 150m/164yd area / Zeon 150 / Psychic Potential 180 / Ki Cost 14 / Summoning 240.

advancedGrade.effect: 300m/328yd area / Zeon 200 / Psychic Potential 240 / Ki Cost 22 / Summoning 280.

arcaneGrade.effect: 500m/546yd area / Zeon 250 / Psychic Potential 280 / Ki Cost 30 / Summoning 320.

spells.name: Strengthen Magic
spells.effect: This spell intensifies the power of the magic used by the caster, making his spells harder to destroy. As long as this spell is maintained, all other spells the caster performs are treated as having increased Zeonic value. This increase is not actual Zeon, so it cannot increase the spell level, but it does make spells harder to destroy. For instance, a character casting Create Light with a Zeonic value of 30 while simultaneously maintaining Strengthen Magic would not see an increase in the Light spell, but if another character cast Destroy against him, the spell would have, to all practical purposes, a Zeonic value of 80 instead of 30.

spells.name: Conditioning
spells.effect: This spell directly affects other spells cast by the spellcaster, stalling them and delaying their activation until the advent of a particular circumstance or moment previously determined by the caster. Conditioning must be cast at the same time as the spells it will affect. Each restricted spell may be subject to a different condition, but once set, a caster can not make any changes at a later date. The conditioned spell automatically activates at the exact designated moment – even if the caster is unaware. For instance, a caster may condition Stop Fall to activate when falling from great heights. In the same way, a necromancer may condition Defeat Death to activate at the time of his death. Conditioned spells that have not been triggered require no maintenance. If theConditioning spell itself disappears; all other spells linked to it also disappear. Any number of spells may be conditioned as long as the total number of Zeon points is below the limit set by spell level. Only one Conditioning spell at a time may be kept active. Spell action will be Active or Passive depending on its own nature. The conditioned spell will activate at the end of the turn its conditions are satisfied.

spells.name: Possession
spells.effect: This spell enables the caster to take control of another individual’s body, temporarily relocating part of his spirit in the host. This allows the caster to use all the abilities of the invaded subject freely or his own. In this second case, the spellcaster uses the physical Characteristics and bonuses of the host. If the victim and the caster have very dissimilar bodies, the GM can apply a penalty between –20 and –40 on account of the difficulty involved the change. The caster can decide to use either his own abilities or his host’s every turn, but he cannot mix them at the same time. The spellcaster’s body remains in a coma for as long as Possession is active. Non-energy damaging attacks will affect the possessed body only, whereas supernatural attacks will subtract Life Points from both. If the body in question is that of a creature with Damage Resistance, the caster suffers only one-tenth of the damage received by the physical form. If the possessed body should die while the caster still has Life Points left, his spirit immediately returns to his original form. Avoiding the effects of the spell requires the victim to pass a MR Check. The affected party is entitled to a new roll each day or each time he is made to carry out an action completely against his nature.

spells.name: Imitate Spells
spells.effect:
This spell allows the caster to imitate a spell being cast before him. Any type of spell, from automatic to maintained ones, can be imitated, provided they are cast in the same round as the Imitate Spell. This spell can even imitate High Magic or Divine spells without the need of the caster having the required Gnosis level to cast them. The caster determines whether to use his own Magic Projection or that of the original caster. 
Maitenance : As per Imitated Spell

spells.name: Innate Magic
spells.effect: This spell increases the environmental magical potential of an area, thus increasing the capability for spellcasters to perform magic innately. The spell enchants an area, within which innate spells have a bonus to Potential (in addition to what the caster’ MA indicates). The caster of Innate Magic can choose who will benefit from this spell.

initialGrade.effect: 25m/27yd area / +10 Zeon Value to Innate Magic.

intermediateGrade.effect: 100m/109yd area / +20 Zeon Value to Innate Magic.

advancedGrade.effect: 250m/273yd area / +30 Zeon Value to Innate Magic.

arcaneGrade.effect: 500m/546yd area / +40 Zeon Value to Innate Magic.

spells.name: Link Maintenance
spells.effect: The spellcaster may assign maintenance payment of one of his spells to somebody else, thus forcing the target to invest Zeon points unknowingly. Link Maintenance can only be used in persons with the Gift, or magical beings or objects. Characters wishing to avoid this spell need to pass a MR Check. Those individuals unaware of the fact that they are being targeted can not roll again for Resistance. If they realize this and try to stop it, they will be granted another Check depending on the type of spell they are being linked to. Daily maintenance spells grant daily Checks, whereas the rest will grant one Check every five turns. Linking stops as soon as the target passes his MR or runs out of Zeon points.

spells.name: The Magistrate
spells.effect: With this spell, the caster acts as a supreme judge of all events that transpire in a radius around him. Within this space, the caster has the power to prohibit any Active Action taken by any person or creature who does not pass a MR Check. This check must be repeated each round in which an Active Action is attempted, unless the caster chooses to allow the action to occur. Only Active Actions may be prohibited, so affected targets may still perform Passive Actions, such as repelling attack. In order the prohibit an action, the caster must be aware of it, so some individuals may be able to overcome the effects of this spell through deception or subterfuge. Prohibiting another’s Active Action counts as a Passive Action for the caster. This spell’s area of effect remains stationary.

spells.name: Predestination
spells.effect: This spell allows the caster to modify future events according to his plan, thus predestining several circumstances in the future. The complexity of the events is left to the caster’s own design. He may preordain one event, leaving the different small happenings that lead up to its realization to chance, or quite on the contrary, he may try to determine each one of the aspects involved in producing a final result. The spell is not meant to cause a completely impossible outcome. However, the odds are limited only by the caster’s imagination. Preordained events may be set for a specific date or they may be scheduled to repeat eternally through time—solstices in leap years, for example.Given the huge complexity of the spell, let’s look at a few examples of what it could be used for: An imprecisePredestination would be a caster’s prediction of misfortune befalling an entire family and their offspring, condemning all their members to a horrible death before reaching a certain age. On the other hand, should the caster wish to be more explicit, he could condemn their first born children to be murdered by wild wolves on the very night of their birth. Naturally, not all predestinations need to be negative; the caster might predestine a child to become a king.However, the future created by the spell is not absolute and inevitable; there is always the chance of preventing it from coming true. Anyone outside the limits preordained by the caster, that is, anyone passing the MR Check, can keep destiny from fulfilling itself. In order to neutralize the actions of third parties, the caster may plan ahead for some security measures inside the limits of the spell. A good example of this would be the inclusion of a clause stating that any one who tries to thwart destiny will be murdered by wolves. Preventing this spell from working only requires that the person, creature, or object with the highest resistance of those directly affected by the spell passes a MR Check at the time the spell is being cast. Those influenced by its effects will not be able to do anything to stop it from happening; chance will inevitably play against them in the most unavoidable of ways. The MR can be repeated only when some of the predestined events have come true. Therefore, the greater the detail the greater the chances of preventing the event. If any of the preordained events should be stopped, the whole spell is cancelled.
